children.name: Detail finite memory det
keywords: Prioritized Borel games are not positional
Finite-memory = Winning strategies can be implemented by a finite automaton
There exists a function f(n) such that the winner in prioritized Borel games with n internal nodes can win with a strategy given by an automaton of size ≤ f(n).
Joint work with: Mikołaj Bojańczyk, Sven Manthe and Paweł Parys
